H0.text: Protons and neutrons make up the mass of an atom.

H1.text: Protons and electrons make up the mass of an atom.

H2.text: Neutrons and molecules are the particles that make up the mass of an atom.

H3.text: Electrons and molecules are the particles that make up the mass of an atom.

A4.text: Protons and neutrons, each with a mass of approximately one dalton, are jointly referred to as nucleons (particles present in atomic nuclei).

A5.text: A proton's mass is approximately 1836 times the mass of an electron.
